byline.contributor: Youssouf Bah contributed reporting from Conakry, Guinea.

abstract: World Health Organization reports end to transmission of Ebola virus in Guinea, one of three West African countries overwhelmed by epidemic; for first time since virus struck in 2014, two 21-day incubation cycles have passed with no new cases reported; government officials announce plans for celebration in capital city of Conakry.
lead_paragraph: The country now enters a three-month period of heightened surveillance during which the virus could re-emerge, as it has done twice in Liberia after it ended transmission.

headline.main: In Guinea, a Hard-Won ‘Victory’ Over Ebola
headline.print_headline: In Guinea, a Hard-Won ‘Victory’ Over Ebola

snippet: The country now enters a three-month period of heightened surveillance during which the virus could re-emerge, as it has done twice in Liberia after it ended transmission.
